Question: In August 51 BC, relations between this person and Ptolemy completely broke down.
Hints: At this point, Caesar abandoned his plans to annex Egypt, instead backing this person's claim to the throne.
This person's son by Caesar, Caesarion, was proclaimed pharaoh by the Egyptians, after Alexandria fell to Octavian.
This person arrived in great state, and so charmed Antony that he chose to spend the winter of 41 BC–40 BC with her in Alexandria.
